cluster_relations.rel_desc: Astronomers have long been puzzled by black holes.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: for decades; since their existence was theorized

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Physicists have also been puzzled by black holes.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: for decades; since their existence was theorized

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject community currently lacks a clear or complete understanding of the object phenomenon and finds it conceptually challenging.
args.justification: Both relations describe scientific communities (astronomers, physicists) experiencing conceptual difficulty or incomplete understanding with respect to the same phenomenon (black holes). The direction and semantics are identical: a cognitive/epistemic state of puzzlement about the object. Using the concise predicate 'is_puzzled_by' captures this shared meaning consistently for both instances.

These relations express an epistemic gap: the subject community does not yet fully understand or explain the black hole phenomena. Grouping them under an 'understanding_gap_relation' class captures this family of cognitive/knowledge-state predicates (e.g., puzzled_by, struggles_to_explain, lacks_theory_for).

The core semantics concern the cognitive/epistemic state of agents (scientific communities) relative to a phenomenon, not material composition, causality, or spatiality. A broad cognitive/knowledge-state category best captures this dimension.
